query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
1 Contra miglior voler voler mal pugna; 2 onde contra ’l piacer mio, per piacerli, 3 trassi de l’acqua non sazia la spugna.
query.error: **English:** 1 Against a stronger will, a weaker will struggles in vain; 2 therefore, against my own pleasure, to please her, 3 I drew the sponge from the water, not yet satisfied.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
4 Mossimi; e ’l duca mio si mosse per li 5 luoghi spediti pur lungo la roccia, 6 come si va per muro stretto a’ merli;
query.error: **English:** 4 I moved, and my guide moved with me through 5 the rapid places, right along the rock, 6 as one goes along a narrow wall to the battlements;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
7 ché la gente che fonde a goccia a goccia 8 per li occhi il mal che tutto ’l mondo occupa, 9 da l’altra parte in fuor troppo s’approccia.
query.error: **English:** 7 for the people who distil drop by drop 8 through their eyes the evil that infects the world, 9 on the other side draw too near.
query.result: 7 Yataḥ janāḥ yaḥ niryanti bindu bindu 8 Cakṣuṣoḥ pāpaṃ yaḥ sarvam jagat ākramataḥ, 9 Aparasmāt pakṣāt atiriktam upaiti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
10 Maladetta sie tu, antica lupa, 11 che più che tutte l’altre bestie hai preda 12 per la tua fame sanza fine cupa!
query.error: **English:** 10 Accursed be you, ancient she-wolf, 11 who more than all other beasts have prey, 12 for your insatiable hunger!
query.result: 10 Śaptā tvam asi, purāṇī vṛkā, 11 yā sarvāṇi anyāni paśūn adhikaṃ bhakṣayasi 12 tava anantaṃ kṣudhāyāḥ kuṭilaṃ gahanam!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
13 O ciel, nel cui girar par che si creda 14 le condizion di qua giù trasmutarsi, 15 quando verrà per cui questa disceda?
query.error: **English:** 13 O heavens, in whose revolution it seems to be believed 14 that the conditions down here can be changed, 15 when will he come for whom this [she-wolf] will depart?
query.result: 13 O dyauḥ, yasya parivartane manyate 14 ihāvartamānāni sthitīni vikurvāṇīti, 15 kadaṃ bhaviṣyati sa yasya nimittam ayam gamiṣyati?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
16 Noi andavam con passi lenti e scarsi, 17 e io attento a l’ombre, ch’i’ sentia 18 pietosamente piangere e lagnarsi;
query.error: **English:** 16 We were going with slow and weary steps, 17 and I was paying attention to the shades, whom I heard 18 piteously weeping and wailing;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
19 e per ventura udi’ «Dolce Maria!» 20 dinanzi a noi chiamar così nel pianto 21 come fa donna che in parturir sia;
query.error: **English:** 19 and by chance I heard "Sweet Mary!" 20 being called out before us in the weeping 21 as a woman does who is in labor;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
22 e seguitar: «Povera fosti tanto, 23 quanto veder si può per quello ospizio 24 dove sponesti il tuo portato santo».
query.error: **English:** 22 and then: "You were so poor, 23 as can be seen from that inn 24 where you gave birth to your holy burden."
query.result: 22 tataś ca anvadhāvat: "Daridrā āsīḥ tvam atiśayam, 23 yathā draṣṭum śakyate tena ātithyaśālāt 24 yatra tvam nyadadhāḥ tava bhāram pavitram."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
25 Seguentemente intesi: «O buon Fabrizio, 26 con povertà volesti anzi virtute 27 che gran ricchezza posseder con vizio».
query.error: **English:** 25 Subsequently I heard: "O good Fabricius, 26 with poverty you preferred virtue 27 rather than possessing great wealth with vice."
query.result: 25 Tataś ca aśrauṣam: "He śubha Fabrīci, 26 Daridryayā saha tvam icchasi satītvaṃ 27 Mahān dhanaḥ sampannaḥ syāt pāpabuddhyā."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
28 Queste parole m’eran sì piaciute, 29 ch’io mi trassi oltre per aver contezza 30 di quello spirto onde parean venute.
query.error: **English:** 28 These words were so pleasing to me, 29 that I moved forward to learn more 30 about the spirit from whom they seemed to come.
query.result: 28 Etāni vacāṃsi mayā tathā priyāṇi āsīt, 29 Yataḥ aham atiriktasyārthasya jñānāya agre agaccham, 30 Yataḥ ayam ātmā āgataḥ iti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
31 Esso parlava ancor de la larghezza 32 che fece Niccolò a le pulcelle, 33 per condurre ad onor lor giovinezza.
query.error: **English:** 31 He was still speaking of the generosity 32 that Niccolò showed to the maidens, 33 to lead their youth to honor.
query.result: 31 Saḥ adhuna api kathitam karoti tasya dānatvasya 32 yat kṛtavān Niccolò yuvatībhyaḥ, 33 yena tāḥ yuvatayaḥ satkāreṇa yujyeran.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
34 «O anima che tanto ben favelle, 35 dimmi chi fosti», dissi, «e perché sola 36 tu queste degne lode rinovelle.
query.error: **English:** 34 "O soul who speakest so well, 35 tell me who you were," I said, "and why alone 36 do you renew these worthy praises.
query.result: 34 "He bhagavann uttamaṃ yaḥ kathasi, 35 bruhi me ko 'bhavas tvam," iti ahaṃ, "kimartham caikaḥ 36 tvam etāḥ śobhanāḥ stutīr abhyanuvadas tvam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
37 Non fia sanza mercé la tua parola, 38 s’io ritorno a compiér lo cammin corto 39 di quella vita ch’al termine vola».
query.error: **English:** 37 Your words will not be without reward, 38 if I return to complete the short journey 39 of that life which is flying towards its end.
query.result: 37 Na bhaviṣyati anukampārahitaṃ tava vacaḥ, 38 yadi aham punarāgacchāmi sampūrṇāya kalpituṃ mārgaṃ hrasvam 39 tasyā jīvanasya yā antaṃ prati patati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
40 Ed elli: «Io ti dirò, non per conforto 41 ch’io attenda di là, ma perché tanta 42 grazia in te luce prima che sie morto.
query.error: **English:** 40 And he: "I will tell you, not for your comfort, 41 which I expect from there, but because so much 42 grace shines in you before you die.
query.result: 40 Sa ca: "Aham vakṣyāmi te, na tava santvanaṃ prati, 41 yat aham tatra pratikṣe, api tu yataḥ tava 42 antaḥ eva tāvad eva anugrahaḥ prakāśate."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
43 Io fui radice de la mala pianta 44 che la terra cristiana tutta aduggia, 45 sì che buon frutto rado se ne schianta.
query.error: **English:** 43 I was the root of the evil plant 44 that overshadows all the Christian land, 45 so that good fruit is seldom plucked from it.
query.result: 43 Aham āsam mūlam asya durvṛkṣasya 44 Yaḥ kṛṣṇāṃ pṛthivīm sarvāṃ ācchādayati, 45 Yataḥ śubhaṃ phalam alpam eva labhyate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
46 Ma se Doagio, Lilla, Guanto e Bruggia 47 potesser, tosto ne saria vendetta; 48 e io la cheggio a lui che tutto giuggia.
query.error: **English:** 46 But if Douai, Lille, Ghent, and Bruges 47 could, vengeance would soon be ours; 48 and I ask it of Him who judges all.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
49 Chiamato fui di là Ugo Ciappetta; 50 di me son nati i Filippi e i Luigi 51 per cui novellamente è Francia retta.
query.error: **English:** 49 I was called Hugh Capet there; 50 from me were born the Philips and the Louises 51 by whom France is newly ruled.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
52 Figliuol fu’ io d’un beccaio di Parigi: 53 quando li regi antichi venner meno 54 tutti, fuor ch’un renduto in panni bigi,
query.error: **English:** 52 I was the son of a butcher of Paris: 53 when the ancient kings came to an end, 54 all except one who was dressed in gray cloth,
query.result: 52 Aham āsam putro māsakṛtaḥ Pāriśasya: 53 Yada rājānaḥ prācīnaḥ gataḥ kṣayam 54 Sarve, vinā ekena yaḥ āsa veṣṭitaḥ vastreṇa dhumravarṇena,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
55 trova’mi stretto ne le mani il freno 56 del governo del regno, e tanta possa 57 di nuovo acquisto, e sì d’amici pieno,
query.error: **English:** 55 I found myself tightly gripping the reins 56 of the government of the kingdom, and so much power 57 newly acquired, and so full of friends,
query.result: 55 Adhigataḥ mayā niyamitaḥ prabhutvasya rājyasya lagāmaḥ, tathā ca bahu parākramaḥ 56 Navaḥ prāptaḥ, tathā ca pūrṇaḥ suhṛdbhiḥ, 57 Yathā mūrdhā mama putrasya abhyudgataḥ śūnyāyām rājakīyāyām śiromaṇaye, yasya

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
58 ch’a la corona vedova promossa 59 la testa di mio figlio fu, dal quale 60 cominciar di costor le sacrate ossa.
query.error: **English:** 58 that to the widowed crown was promised 59 the head of my son, from whom 60 the sacred bones of these began.
query.result: 58 yā vidhavāyai rājapatnīyai pratijñātā 59 mama putrasya śiraḥ, yasmāt 60 etāḥ pavanīya aस्थīni prārabdhāni.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
61 Mentre che la gran dota provenzale 62 al sangue mio non tolse la vergogna, 63 poco valea, ma pur non facea male.
query.error: **English:** 61 While the great dowry from Provence 62 did not remove the shame from my bloodline, 63 it was worth little, but still did no harm.
query.result: 61 Yāvad ayam mahān dāyabhāgaḥ prāveśikaḥ 62 Mama rakta-kula-kaluṣaṃ na nirakarot, 63 Alpa eva mūlyavān āsīt, tathāpi na doṣāya bhāvayati sma.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
64 Lì cominciò con forza e con menzogna 65 la sua rapina; e poscia, per ammenda, 66 Pontì e Normandia prese e Guascogna.
query.error: **English:** 64 There he began with force and with deceit 65 his plundering; and then, as amends, 66 he seized Ponthieu and Normandy and Gascony.
query.result: 64 Tatra sa balena mithyācāreṇa ca 65 svaṃ harṣaṇam ārabhata; tataś ca prāyaścittam iva 66 Pontivum, Normandīyaṃ, Vāskoniyaṃ ca agrehīt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
67 Carlo venne in Italia e, per ammenda, 68 vittima fé di Curradino; e poi 69 ripinse al ciel Tommaso, per ammenda.
query.error: **English:** 67 Charles came to Italy and, as amends, 68 made Conradin a victim; and then 69 Thomas returned to heaven, as amends.
query.result: 67 Kārolas Itāliyāṃ prāptaḥ, prāyaścittaṃ ca kṛtvā, 68 Kurāḍinasya vadham cakāra; tataś ca 69 Tamāsaḥ svargam prāptaḥ, prāyaścittaṃ kṛtvā.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
70 Tempo vegg’ io, non molto dopo ancoi, 71 che tragge un altro Carlo fuor di Francia, 72 per far conoscer meglio e sé e ’ suoi.
query.error: **English:** 70 I see a time, not long from now, 71 when another Charles will come out of France, 72 to make himself and his followers better known.
query.result: 70 Kālaṃ paśyāmi, na ciraṃ tataḥ paścāt, 71 Yaḥ anyam Kālam niṣkārayiṣyati Frāṃsāt, 72 Svayam eva ca svakānś ca prakaṭatarān kartum.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
73 Sanz’ arme n’esce e solo con la lancia 74 con la qual giostrò Giuda, e quella ponta 75 sì, ch’a Fiorenza fa scoppiar la pancia.
query.error: **English:** 73 Unarmed he emerges and with only the lance 74 with which Judas jousted, and that point 75 so that it makes the belly of Florence burst open.
query.result: 73 Astrairahitena niryāti sa ekena śaktyā eva 74 yayā yudhyate Yūdhāḥ, sā ca agra eva 75 yāyāḥ prahāreṇa Florentia-nagarasya udaram sphuṭati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
76 Quindi non terra, ma peccato e onta 77 guadagnerà, per sé tanto più grave, 78 quanto più lieve simil danno conta.
query.error: **English:** 76 Therefore, not land, but sin and disgrace 77 he will gain, for himself so much more grievous, 78 as he counts such loss more slight.
query.result: 76 Ata eva na bhūmiṃ, api tu pāpaṃ ca nindāṃ ca 77 Prāpsyati, ātmanaḥ eva atibhāraṃ, 78 Yāvad eva laghu manyate tādṛśaṃ hānim.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
79 L’altro, che già uscì preso di nave, 80 veggio vender sua figlia e patteggiarne 81 come fanno i corsar de l’altre schiave.
query.error: **English:** 79 The other, who had already left by ship, 80 I see selling his daughter and bargaining for her 81 as the pirates do with other slaves.
query.result: 79 Anyaḥ tu yaḥ pūrvam nāvāyā nirgataḥ āsīt, 80 Tam paśyāmi vikrīṇantam svakanyām kraya-vikrayaṃ ca kurvaṇtam, 81 Yathā daस्यāḥ anyāḥ dāsīḥ vikrīṇanti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
82 O avarizia, che puoi tu più farne, 83 poscia c’ha’ il mio sangue a te sì tratto, 84 che non si cura de la propria carne?
query.error: **English:** 82 O avarice, what more can you do to me, 83 since you have drawn my blood so much to you, 84 that you do not care about my own flesh?
query.result: 82 He durlabha, kim tvam adhikam kartum śaknosi, 83 yataḥ mama raktam tvayi tathā ākrṣṭam asti, 84 yena mama sva-māṃsena na te kaścid api hṛdaya-vikāraḥ sambhavati?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
85 Perché men paia il mal futuro e ’l fatto, 86 veggio in Alagna intrar lo fiordaliso, 87 e nel vicario suo Cristo esser catto.
query.error: **English:** 85 So that I may suffer the evil to come and the evil done, 86 I see the fleur-de-lis enter Alagna, 87 and Christ being held captive in his vicar.
query.result: 85 Yathā mama bhaviṣyad api duḥkham tathaiva kṛtam api duḥkham prāpnuyaṃ, 86 Alagna-nagare puṣpa-lakṣaṇam paśyāmi praveśayet, 87 tathā tasya sthāniye Kṛṣṭaṃ bandhitam paśyāmi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
88 Veggiolo un’altra volta esser deriso; 89 veggio rinovellar l’aceto e ’l fiele, 90 e tra vivi ladroni esser anciso.
query.error: **English:** 88 I see him mocked once more; 89 I see the vinegar and gall renewed, 90 and him killed among living thieves.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
91 Veggio il novo Pilato sì crudele, 92 che ciò nol sazia, ma sanza decreto 93 portar nel Tempio le cupide vele.
query.error: **English:** 91 I see the new Pilate so cruel, 92 that this does not satisfy him, but without decree 93 he carries the greedy sails into the Temple.
query.result: 91 Paśyāmi navaṃ Pilataṃ tāṃdṛśaṃ nṛśaṃsam, 92 Yena ayam na trpyati, kim tu anājñaptram eva 93 Harṣitaṃ patākāṃ mandire nayati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
94 O Segnor mio, quando sarò io lieto 95 a veder la vendetta che, nascosa, 96 fa dolce l’ira tua nel tuo secreto?
query.error: **English:** 94 O my Lord, when shall I be glad 95 to see the vengeance that, hidden, 96 makes Your wrath sweet in Your secret place?
query.result: 94 He Prabho, kada aham bhaviṣyāmi hṛṣṭaḥ 95 pratiśodhanaṃ draṣṭum yat, gūḍham, 96 tava kopam tava guhye madhuram karoti?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
97 Ciò ch’io dicea di quell’ unica sposa 98 de lo Spirito Santo e che ti fece 99 verso me volger per alcuna chiosa,
query.error: **English:** 97 What I said of that unique bride 98 of the Holy Spirit, who made You 99 turn to me for some explanation,
query.result: 97 Yat aham avocatam tasyāḥ ekatvāṃ prati vadhūḥ 98 Pavitra-Ātmanaḥ yā ca cakāra tvām 99 mama prati pariṇamanaṃ kevalam vyākhyānārtham,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
100 tanto è risposto a tutte nostre prece 101 quanto ’l dì dura; ma com’ el s’annotta, 102 contrario suon prendemo in quella vece.
query.error: **English:** 100 is answered to all our prayers 101 as long as the day lasts; but when night falls, 102 we take up the opposite tune instead.
query.result: 100 tāvatā sarvāṇi asmākaṃ prārthanāni uttarīkṛtāni bhavanti 101 yāvat divāsaḥ vartate; yadā tu rātriḥ bhavati, 102 viparyastam dhvanim gṛhṇāmaḥ tasmin sthāne.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
103 Noi repetiam Pigmalïon allotta, 104 cui traditore e ladro e paricida 105 fece la voglia sua de l’oro ghiotta;
query.error: **English:** 103 We repeated Pygmalion's lot, 104 whom his own greed, gluttonous for gold, 105 made a traitor, a thief, and a parricide.
query.result: 103 Vayam punar api Pygmalionasya daśām prāpnumaḥ, 104 yam svayam eva kāmaḥ suvarṇalobhī 105 dravyaghātakam coram ca pitṛghātakam ca cakāra.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
106 e la miseria de l’avaro Mida, 107 che seguì a la sua dimanda gorda, 108 per la qual sempre convien che si rida.
query.error: **English:** 106 and the misery of the miserly Midas, 107 who, because of his insatiable greed, 108 is always a subject of ridicule.
query.result: 106 tathā daridratāṃ kṛpaṇasya Mida, 107 yaḥ anugataḥ āsīt tasya abhilāṣasya alubdhasya, 108 yena nityaṃ eva hasitum ucitam asti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
109 Del folle Acàn ciascun poi si ricorda, 110 come furò le spoglie, sì che l’ira 111 di Iosüè qui par ch’ancor lo morda.
query.error: **English:** 109 Everyone remembers the foolish Achan, 110 how his spoils were burned, so that the wrath 111 of Joshua here seems still to bite him.
query.result: 109 Mūḍhasya Acānaḥ paścāt sarve smaryante, 110 Yathā tasya vastūni dagdhāni āsīt, yataḥ kopaḥ 111 Jośuaḥ atraiva adhunāpi tam daśati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
115 Polinestòr ch’ancise Polidoro; 116 ultimamente ci si grida: “Crasso, 117 dilci, che ’l sai: di che sapore è l’oro?”.
query.error: **English:** 115 who slew Polydorus is reviled; 116 finally we are shouted at: “Crassus, 117 tell us, for you know: what does gold taste like?”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
118 Talor parla l’uno alto e l’altro basso, 119 secondo l’affezion ch’ad ir ci sprona 120 ora a maggiore e ora a minor passo:
query.error: **English:** 118 Sometimes one speaks high and the other low, 119 according to the affection that spurs us on, 120 now at a faster and now at a slower pace.
query.result: 118 Kadācid ekaḥ uttamaḥ anyaḥ adhamaḥ ca bruvate, 119 Yathā snehaḥ yaḥ asmān pravartanāya prerayati, 120 Kadācid adhika-gatau kadācid alpāyām gatau ca.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
121 però al ben che ’l dì ci si ragiona, 122 dianzi non era io sol; ma qui da presso 123 non alzava la voce altra persona».
query.error: **English:** 121 But as for the good that we discuss during the day, 122 earlier I was not alone; but here nearby 123 no other person raised their voice.
query.result: 121 Tathāpi tasmin śubhe yaḥ viṣayaḥ ahnā asmābhiḥ kathitaḥ, 122 Pūrvam aham eva nābhvam; atra tu santike 123 Na anyā kaścid vyaktiḥ śabdam udgacchati sma.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
124 Noi eravam partiti già da esso, 125 e brigavam di soverchiar la strada 126 tanto quanto al poder n’era permesso,
query.error: **English:** 124 We had already departed from him, 125 and were striving to overcome the road 126 as much as our power permitted us,
query.result: 124 Vayam tataḥ tasmāt sthānāt pravṛttāḥ, 125 caṇḍamārgaṃ vijitya gantum yatnam ārabdhāḥ, 126 yāvat asmākaṃ śaktir abhavat,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
127 quand’ io senti’, come cosa che cada, 128 tremar lo monte; onde mi prese un gelo 129 qual prender suol colui ch’a morte vada.
query.error: **English:** 127 when I heard, like something falling, 128 the mountain tremble; whereupon a chill seized me 129 such as seizes him who goes to his death.
query.result: 127 tadā aham aśrauṣam, patanasīlasya vastunaḥ iva, 128 parvataṃ kampamānam; yataḥ mama śarīre śītaṃ jātam, 129 yathā mṛtyumukhe sthitasya puruṣasya jāyate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
130 Certo non si scoteo sì forte Delo, 131 pria che Latona in lei facesse ’l nido 132 a parturir li due occhi del cielo.
query.error: **English:** 130 Surely Delos did not tremble so violently, 131 before Latona made her nest there 132 to give birth to the two eyes of heaven.
query.result: 130 Na khalu Delos evam kampate, 131 pūrvam yadā Latā tatra nīḍam cakāra 132 svargasya dvayoḥ netrayoḥ jananāya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
133 Poi cominciò da tutte parti un grido 134 tal, che ’l maestro inverso me si feo, 135 dicendo: «Non dubbiar, mentr’ io ti guido».
query.error: **English:** 133 Then from every side a cry began, 134 such that the master turned to me, 135 saying: "Do not doubt, while I guide you."
query.result: 133 Tataḥ sarvataḥ krandanam ārabdhvam, 134 Yathā guruḥ mama prati mukhaḥ abhavat, 135 Vadan: "Mā śaṅkā kuru, yāvad aham tvām nayāmi."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
136 ‘Glorïa in excelsis’ tutti ‘Deo’ 137 dicean, per quel ch’io da’ vicin compresi, 138 onde intender lo grido si poteo.
query.error: **English:** 136 ‘Glory to God in the highest’ all ‘God’ 137 were saying, from what I understood from nearby, 138 whence the cry could be understood.
query.result: 136 ‘Gloriam akāśe’ sarve ‘Devāya’ 137 āhuḥ, yataḥ aham āsannihitāt pratyabudhām, 138 yataḥ tasya nādasya arthaḥ jñātum aśakata.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
139 No’ istavamo immobili e sospesi 140 come i pastor che prima udir quel canto, 141 fin che ’l tremar cessò ed el compiési.
query.error: **English:** 139 We were not standing still and suspended 140 like the shepherds who first heard that song, 141 until the trembling ceased and he completed it.
query.result: 139 Na ca sthitāḥ smaḥ sthāṇur iva niścalāḥ 140 Yathā gopāḥ prathamam tad gītam ākarṇayantīti, 141 Yāvat kampanaṃ nirvṛttaṃ ca sa ca pūrṇam akārṣīt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
142 Poi ripigliammo nostro cammin santo, 143 guardando l’ombre che giacean per terra, 144 tornate già in su l’usato pianto.
query.error: **English:** 142 Then we resumed our holy journey, 143 looking at the shadows that lay on the ground, 144 already returned to their accustomed weeping.
query.result: 142 Tataḥ punar ārabdhāvām āvām āvābhyām punyaḥ panthāḥ, 143 avalokayantau chāyāḥ yāḥ āsan bhūmau, 144 pratyāgatāḥ punaḥ svabhāvataḥ śokam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
145 Nulla ignoranza mai con tanta guerra 146 mi fé desideroso di sapere, 147 se la memoria mia in ciò non erra,
query.error: **English:** 145 No ignorance ever with so much warfare 146 made me desirous of knowing, 147 if my memory does not err in this,
query.result: 145 Na kadācid ajñānam evaṃ yuddhena saha 146 Jijñāsāṃ cakāra māṃ vidhātum, 147 Yadi mama smṛtiḥ atra na bhrāntā,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
148 quanta pareami allor, pensando, avere; 149 né per la fretta dimandare er’ oso, 150 né per me lì potea cosa vedere:
query.error: **English:** 148 how much I seemed to myself to have, then, thinking about it; 149 nor was I so bold as to ask because of the haste, 150 nor could I see anything there for myself:
query.result: 148 Yāvatī mama abhūt, tadā cintāyan, 149 Na ca spṛhāyāḥ kālaparicchedena prcchitum śaknoti sma aham, 150 Na ca mama tatra kiṃcid draṣṭum śakyate sma:

query.error: **English:** 151 thus I went, timid and thoughtful.
query.result: 151 Evam aham bibhyat, cintāparaś ca agaccham.
